intro: Arrabidaea coleocalyx, commonly known as the white bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the family Bignoniaceae and is characterized by its showy, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release its seeds, aiding in its propagation.
